00003 #ifndef GeoidLibrary_H
00004 #define GeoidLibrary_H
00005 
00006 /***************************************************************************/
00007 /* RSC IDENTIFIER:  Geoid Library
00008  *
00009  * ABSTRACT
00010  *
00011  *    The purpose of GEOID is to support conversions between WGS84 ellipsoid
00012  *    heights and WGS84 geoid heights.
00013  *
00014  *
00015  * ERROR HANDLING
00016  *
00017  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00018  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using
00019  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00020  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00021  *
00022  *  GEOID_NO_ERROR               : No errors occured in function
00023  *  GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR        : Geoid file opening error
00024  *  GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR       : Geoid seoaration database can not initialize
00025  *  GEOID_LAT_ERROR              : Latitude out of valid range
00026  *                                 (-90 to 90 degrees)
00027  *  GEOID_LON_ERROR              : Longitude out of valid range
00028  *                                 (-180 to 360 degrees)
00029  *
00030  * REUSE NOTES
00031  *
00032  *    Geoid is intended for reuse by any application that requires conversion
00033  *    between WGS84 ellipsoid heights and WGS84 geoid heights.
00034  *
00035  * REFERENCES
00036  *
00037  *    Further information on Geoid can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00038  *
00039  *    Geoid originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00040  *                             Geospatial Information Division
00041  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00042  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00043  *
00044  * LICENSES
00045  *
00046  *    None apply to this component.
00047  *
00048  * RESTRICTIONS
00049  *
00050  *    Geoid has no restrictions.
00051  *
00052  * ENVIRONMENT
00053  *
00054  *    Geoid was tested and certified in the following environments
00055  *
00056  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00057  *    2. MS Windows XP with MS Visual C++ 6.0
00058  *
00059  *
00060  * MODIFICATIONS
00061  *
00062  *    Date              Description
00063  *    ----              -----------
00064  *    24-May-99         Original Code
00065  *    09-Jan-06         Added new geoid height interpolation methods
00066  *    03-14-07          Original C++ Code
00067  *
00068  */
00069 
00070 #include <vector>

00104 
00105       /*
00106        * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidHeight converts the specified WGS84
00107        * ellipsoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00108        * geoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the bilinear interpolation method.
00109        *
00110        *    longitude          : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00111        *    latitude           : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00112        *    ellipsoidHeight    : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (input)
00113        *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)
00114        *
00115        */
00116 
00117       void convertEllipsoidToEGM96FifteenMinBilinearGeoidHeight( double longitude, double latitude,  double ellipsoidHeight, double *geoidHeight );
00118 
00119 
00120       /*
00121        * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM96VariableNaturalSplineHeight converts the specified WGS84
00122        * ellipsoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00123        * geoid height, using the EGM96 gravity model and the natural spline interpolation method..
00124        *
00125        *    longitude          : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00126        *    latitude           : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00127        *    ellipsoidHeight    : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (input)
00128        *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)
00129        *
00130        */
00131 
00132       void convertEllipsoidToEGM96VariableNaturalSplineHeight( double longitude, double latitude, double ellipsoidHeight, double *geoidHeight );
00133 
00134 
00135       /*
00136        * The function convertEllipsoidToEGM84TenDegBilinearHeight converts the specified WGS84
00137        * ellipsoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent
00138        * geoid height, using the EGM84 gravity model and the bilinear interpolation method..
00139        *
00140        *    longitude          : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00141        *    latitude           : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00142        *    ellipsoidHeight    : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (input)
00143        *    geoidHeight        : Geoid height, in meters.               (output)

00154        *
00155        *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)

00167        * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent

00169        *
00170        *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)

00182        * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent

00184        *
00185        *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00186        *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00187        *    geoidHeight         : Geoid height, in meters.               (input)
00188        *    ellipsoidHeight     : Ellipsoid height, in meters            (output)
00189        *
00190        */
00191

00197        * geoid height at the specified geodetic coordinates to the equivalent

00240     private:

00242       static GeoidLibrary* instance;
00243       static int instanceCount;
00244 
00245       /* List of EGM96 elevations */
00246       std::vector<float> egm96GeoidList;
00247 
00248       /* List of EGM84 elevations */
00249       std::vector<float> egm84GeoidList;
00250 
00251     
00252       /*
00253        * The function loadGeoids reads geoid separation data from a file in
00254        * the current directory and builds the geoid separation table from it.
00255        * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00256        * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00257        * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00258        * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned. This function must be called before 
00259        * any of the other functions in this component.
00260        */
00261 
00262       void loadGeoids();
00263 
00264 
00265       /*
00266        * The function initializeEGM96Geoid reads geoid separation data from the egm96.grd
00267        *  file in the current directory and builds a geoid separation table from it.
00268        * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00269        * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00270        * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00271        * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned.
00272        */
00273 
00274       void initializeEGM96Geoid();
00275 
00276 
00277       /*
00278        * The function initializeEGM84Geoid reads geoid separation data from a file in
00279        * the current directory and builds the geoid separation table from it.
00280        * If the separation file can not be found or accessed, an error code of
00281        * GEOID_FILE_OPEN_ERROR is returned, If the separation file is incomplete
00282        * or improperly formatted, an error code of GEOID_INITIALIZE_ERROR is returned,
00283        * otherwise GEOID_NO_ERROR is returned.
00284        */
00285 
00286       void initializeEGM84Geoid();
00287 
00288 
00289       /*
00290        * The private function bilinearInterpolate returns the height of the
00291        * WGS84 geoid above or below the WGS84 ellipsoid, at the
00292        * specified geodetic coordinates, using a grid of height adjustments
00293        * and the bilinear interpolation method.
00294        *
00295        *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00296        *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00297        *    scale_factor        : Grid scale factor                      (input)
00298        *    num_cols            : Number of columns in grid              (input)
00299        *    num_rows            : Number of rows in grid                 (input)
00300        *    height_buffer       : Grid of height adjustments             (input)
00301        *    delta_height        : Height Adjustment, in meters.          (output)
00302        *
00303        */
00304 
00305       void bilinearInterpolate( double longitude, double latitude, double scale_factor, int num_cols, int num_rows,
00306                                 std::vector<float>& height_buffer,  double *delta_height );
00307 
00308 
00309       /*
00310        * The private function naturalSplineInterpolate returns the height of the
00311        * WGS84 geoid above or below the WGS84 ellipsoid, at the
00312        * specified geodetic coordinates, using a grid of height adjustments
00313        * and the natural spline interpolation method.
00314        *
00315        *    longitude           : Geodetic longitude in radians          (input)
00316        *    latitude            : Geodetic latitude in radians           (input)
00317        *    scale_factor        : Grid scale factor                      (input)
00318        *    num_cols            : Number of columns in grid              (input)
00319        *    num_rows            : Number of rows in grid                 (input)
00320        *    height_buffer       : Grid of height adjustments             (input)
00321        *    DeltaHeight         : Height Adjustment, in meters.          (output)
00322        *
00323        */
00324 
00325       void naturalSplineInterpolate( double longitude, double latitude, double scale_factor, int num_cols, int num_rows,
00326                                      int max_index, std::vector<float>& height_buffer, double *delta_height );
00327
